body.directions: Listen to the audio, and complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following items can be worn to best match the word in the audio?
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! 短裤 duǎnkù means “shorts.” Shorts are commonly worn for warm or hot weather and may be best matched with a pair of sandals.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the phrase again. Think about its meaning, and then consider in what weather you may wear it and what item in the choices can best go along with it.

body.quiz: In which of the situations is it least appropriate to wear the item in the audio?
body.answer: When you give a speech at a national conference
options: When you have a playdate with a friend
When you go grocery shopping with a family member
When you visit your grandparents on the weekend
body.correct: Fantastic job! 牛仔裤 niúzǎikù means “jeans.” It’s casual wear and may not be the most appropriate attire when you give a formal speech to a large audience.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again, and identify the meaning of the word. Then consider what type of clothing it is. Imagine yourself wearing it in the different situations in the choices, and see in which one it may not seem appropriate to you.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed with the word in the audio?
options: 我需要练习____。 Wǒ xūyào liànxí____.
他九点上____课。 Tā jiǔ diǎn shàng____kè.
body.correct: Outstanding job!天气 tiānqì means “weather.” Of the four sentences it can best complete the fourth one: 今天天气很好。 Jīntiān tiānqì hěnhǎo. (The weather today is very good.)
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word again. Think about its meaning. Then fit it in the four sentences in the choices to see which one makes the most sense to you.

body.quiz: Which of the following words is the antonym (word with opposite meaning) of the word in the audio?
body.correct: Terrifically done! 暖和 nuǎnhuomeans “warm,” and its opposite should be 凉 liáng (cool), which is the first character in the word 凉鞋 liángxié (sandals).
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word again. Consider its meaning. Then review the four single-character words in the choices to see which one has its opposite meaning.
